extracted_content.title: Health and Safety Laws for California Employers

key_points: California employers are required to have Workers’ Compensation insurance to pay for medical care in the event of work-related injuries and illnesses.
Employers must have a written Injury Illness Prevention Program that incorporates COVID-19 prevention regulations issued by CalOSHA.
A written log of injuries and illnesses that occur in the workplace may be required.
Employers must maintain a safe workplace, including providing and paying for personal protective equipment employees need to do their jobs safely.
The required Cal/OSHA poster must be prominently posted to inform employees of their rights and responsibilities.
